items.title: Tree Hanging Death at Delta State University Raises Dread of Mississippi’s Past Lynchings
items.description: A Black freshman’s apparent suicide on campus is one of at least nine Black men who have been found hanging from trees since 2000.

items.title: A Leading Prison Journalist Upends Our Obsession With True Crime
items.description: John J. Lennon tells Bill Keller that he “wanted to tell a different story about the guilty” in his new book.

items.title: Trump Says Federal Deployments Make Cities Safer. Local Officials Disagree.
items.description: In Chicago, Memphis and elsewhere, residents allege a surge of federal agents and military troops is making it harder to police and prosecute crime.

items.title: Who Should Pay Victims of Police Misconduct? Only the Officers, Some Cities Say.
items.description: Denver, Minneapolis and other cities want to avoid paying large sums owed to victims of some types of misconduct. But will the officers pay up?

items.title: The Last Words of a Man Who Died in Prison From a Treatable Cancer
items.description: Months before his death, Ralph Marcus explained how a COVID-era leg injury led to a rare bone cancer that didn’t have to be fatal.
